title: julia 0.5.2 installation fails with "gtk-update-icon-cache: No theme index file"
body:
Hi,

I am trying to install julia@0.5.2 with the following command:

`spack install julia@0.5.2+binutils+hdf5+mpi+plot+python+simd ^binutils@2.28 ^cmake@3.4.3+ncurses+openssl ^curl@7.53.1 ^m4@1.4.18 ^openssl@1.0.1e ^python@2.7.13+tk ^/fcexqkt ^py-pil@1.1.7 ^hdf5@1.10.1+cxx~debug+fortran~mpi+pic+shared+szip~threadsafe ^openmpi@2.1.0+cuda+java+sqlite3+thread_multiple+vt ^util-macros@1.19.1 ^xproto@7.0.29 ^libpthread-stubs@0.3 ^libx11@1.6.3 ^gettext@0.19.8.1+bzip2+curses+git+libunistring+libxml2+tar+xz ^libpng@1.6.27 ^freetype@2.7 %gcc@4.8.5 arch=linux-centos7-x86-64`

The compilation so far works fine, but in the installation step it always fails with:

```
gtk-update-icon-cache /cluster/spack/apps/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-4.8.5/julia-0.5.2-j4pgl2sm34cqnexwa7dc3uora4njanam/share/icons/hicolor/
gtk-update-icon-cache: No theme index file.
Makefile:332: recipe for target 'install' failed
make: [install] Error 1 (ignored)
```

This problem is discussed in

https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/pull/8500

but they do not really provide a solution. They just say this happens if julia is not installed in the usual system location "/usr".

Did anybody else encounter this problem ? And if yes, how did you handle it ?

Best regards

Sam
